definitions.definition: a situation, an event, etc. that makes it difficult for you to do or achieve something
definitions.sensetop: obstacle to doing somethingobstacle to somebody doing somethingobstacle to something

examples.text: So far, we have managed to overcome all the obstacles that have been placed in our path.
A lack of qualifications can be a major obstacle to finding a job.
The MP claims that there is now no obstacle to him standing at the next general election.
The huge distances involved have proved an obstacle to communication between villages.
Lack of money has proved an almost insurmountable obstacle.
The attitude of the unions is a serious obstacle.
The release of prisoners remains an obstacle in the path of a peace agreement.

phrases: an obstacle in the path (of somebody/​something)
an obstacle in the way (of somebody/​something)

definitions.definition: an object that is in your way and that makes it difficult for you to move forward

examples.text: The area was full of streams and bogs and other natural obstacles.
He managed with difficulty to negotiate the obstacles strewn across the floor.

definitions.definition: a fence, etc. for a horse to jump over

examples.text: This huge open ditch forms the biggest obstacle on the course.

wordOrigin: Middle English: via Old French from Latin obstaculum, from obstare ‘impede’, from ob- ‘against’ + stare ‘stand’.
